N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 521.2 - Legal base

State Regulations
(a) Section
7.07
of the

Mental Hygiene Law sets forth the authority of OMH for assuring the development
of plans, services and programs for the mentally ill. The office has the
responsibility to provide appropriate facilities and encourage the provision of
facilities by local governments and community organizations and
agencies. (b) Sections
7.09
and
31.04
of
the Mental Hygiene Law grant the Commissioner of Mental Health the power and
responsibility to adopt rules and regulations necessary and proper to implement
any matter under his jurisdiction. (c) Sections
41.15, 41.18
and
41.23
of
the Mental Hygiene Law set forth the authority of the Office of Mental Health
to provide State aid funding for the capital costs for community mental health
facilities, pursuant to a local services or unified services plan. (d) Sections
75.17
and
75.19
of
the Mental Hygiene Law set forth the authority of the commissioner to approve
mortgage loans for funds available from the Housing Finance Agency. (e) Section
75.25
of
the Mental Hygiene Law sets forth the authority of the commissioner to make, alter, amend and repeal rules and regulations for the supervision, examination, regulation and audit of companies. (f) Subdivision 13-c of section 5 of the

Facilities Development Corporation Act sets forth the authority of the
commissioner to promulgate regulations with respect to financing or refinancing
of community facilities by voluntary agencies with the proceeds of funds
realized from the sale of tax-exempt bonds and notes issued by Medical Care

Facilities Finance Agency. Notes
